message:
OK. After installing DoctorJS, JSHint & Syntastic, I know have a really cool, fully-working JavaScript IDE in Vim. Function listing and syntax checking and everything. :)

However, one woe - Syntastic is displaying errors in the (seperate) location-list window, and the status-line only reports the amount of errors in the file.

It is very uncomfortable to open-and-close the location-list window all the time.

I would like to have the feature like in the pyflakes.vim plugin, where moving with the cursor to a line marked with an error to show the error in the status-line.

Anybody knows how to do this?
You can navigate the location/quickfix lists without opening them using the commands: :lnext, :lprev, :lfirst and :llast (or for the quickfix, replace `:l` with `:c`)
Better still, install unimpaired (https://github.com/tpope/vim-unimpaired) and you'll get mappings: [q, ]q, [Q and ]Q for the quickfix, and [l, ]l, [L and ]L for the location lists.
I mean, it does display the error on the statusline *when* exeucting the above comments, but I want that to happen automagically.
Thanks, but this doesn't resolve the problem. :)
This bugs me too. The messages do show in the bottom message area when you use the location list navigation shortcuts, but I'd like the cursor-following. Two possibilities:

Doh, I guess Ctrl+Enter does not a newline make. So, 1.) Live with the clutter of two plugins: set JS in Syntastic's disabled filetypes and use the JSHint plug that behaves this way (https://github.com/wookiehangover/jshint.vim), or 2.) Merge this in your copy or use the fork: https://github.com/scrooloose/syntastic/pull/46
Well, I guess I'll just wait for the merge to happen. This should fix things. :)
I've tried to make a general plugin to show the errors from Syntastic, a quickfix list or location list automagically -- http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=3722
